headline: Disgust abounds after three House Republicans vote no on resolution supporting Ukraine
sentences:
— Adam Kinzinger (@AdamKinzinger) March 2, 2022
x

— Adam Kinzinger (@AdamKinzinger) March 2, 2022
x
Paul Gosar joins with two other Republicans to vote no on a resolution supporting the people of Ukraine pic.twitter.com/7WZM4CFyuz
— Acyn (@Acyn) March 2, 2022
x
Fascist pro-Putin MAGA traitors Paul Gosar, Thomas Massie, & Matt Rosendale just voted against a resolution to help the people of Ukraine.

The non-binding resolution, among other things, says the House "supports, unequivocally, Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity" and "states unambiguously that it will never recognize or support any illegitimate Russian-controlled leader or government installed through the use of force."

Insider:
Rep. Paul Gosar of Arizona, Rep. Thomas Massie of Kentucky, and Rep. Matt Rosendale of Montana were the only nay votes on House Resolution 956, titled "Supporting the People of Ukraine."
Three members of the Congressional Putin Caucus (fka the GOP) have somehow seen fit to vote against a resolution supporting Ukraine in the wake of Russia’s elective war of aggression.

— The USA Singers (@TheUSASingers) March 2, 2022
x
Thomas Massie, Paul Gosar and Matt Rosendale just voted against a resolution that was passed to support the people of Ukraine.
I thought we unreservedly supported fellow democracies, but I guess the calculus shifted sometime after Donald Trump gave Putin that very public reach-around in Helsinki.
It ends by stating the House "stands steadfastly, staunchly, proudly, and fervently behind the Ukrainian people in their fight against the authoritarian Putin regime."
I can see why that statement would be controversial, as it says nothing at all about Paul Gosar getting free Costco hot dogs for life.

x
Paul Gosar, Rosendale, and Thomas Massie just voted NO in the house of reps on a resolution supporting the people of Ukraine.
It’s an odd choice for members of a party that’s already under heavy scrutiny for its past appeasement of the Russian dictator.
Did they think Congress was taking orders for a delivery of Ukrainian food, and they simply aren’t fans of beet-based cuisine?
